thread.title_full: How Beth Israel’s operating rooms have changed in the last 100 years - News

author: boston.com
title: How Beth Israel’s operating rooms have changed in the last 100 years - News
text:
Previous -- of -- Next The original hospital at 691 Mass. Ave. in Boston, in 1907. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next The first operation was performed at the hospital in 1915 on Townsend Street in Roxbury. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next An operating room at Townsend Street in 1919. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next An operating room in the Deaconess Building in the Longwood area in 1923. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next An operating room in the Brookline Avenue building in 1938. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next An open-heart surgery using a heart-lung machine in 1970. Courtesy of BIDMC Previous -- of -- Next One of the hospital's current operating rooms. Courtesy of BIDMC Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center looked back on Thursday at the evolution of the hospital’s operating rooms since its first operation in 1915.
For #TBT , we?re looking at how the OR has changed since our first operation back in 1915. pic.twitter.com/VGTr0CEQMw
